div.div: Commented on #1214 Somethign wrong with my TEXT LINES, they are too long or too SMALL
Commented on #33 feat: Implement Phase 5 - JSON validation and API improvements
Note: I plan to create a new issue plan to thoroughly review and update docs/api-reference.md
Closed #27 Phase 5: Server Features Implementation - JSON Validation and API Improvements

feat: Implement Phase 5 - JSON validation and API improvements (#33)
This PR implements Phase 5 of the server features, adding comprehensive JSON validation for deprecated fields and API improvements to match the TypeScript implementation behavior.
## Key Features Implemented
###
Deprecated Field Validation Middleware
Implemented middleware that intercepts raw JSON requests before deserialization to validate deprecated fields:
```rust // Before: No validation of deprecated fields pub async fn generate_pot(request: PotRequest) -> Result<...> { // Fields already filtered out by struct deserialization }
// After: Middleware validates raw JSON first pub async fn validate_deprecated_fields_middleware(request: Request, next: Next) -> Result<...> { if obj.contains_key("data_sync_id") { return Err(ErrorResponse::with_context( "data_sync_id is deprecated, use content_binding instead", "deprecated_field_validation" )); } } ```
This matches the TypeScript server's behavior exactly: ```typescript if (body.data_sync_id) return response.status(400).send({ error: "data_sync_id is deprecated, use content_binding instead", }); ```
###
Enhanced Error Response Format
Extended the `ErrorResponse` type with contextual information while maintaining backward compatibility:
```rust #[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)] pub struct ErrorResponse { pub error: String, #[serde(skip_serializing_if = "Option::is_none")] pub context: Option<String>, #[serde(skip_serializing_if = "Option::is_none")] pub details: Option<serde_json::Value>, #[serde(skip_serializing_if = "Option::is_none")] pub timestamp: Option<DateTime<Utc>>, #[serde(skip_serializing_if = "Option::is_none")] pub version: Option<String>, } ```
###
Health Check and Service Info Endpoints
Added two new endpoints for better observability:
- **`/health`** - Returns detailed health information with uptime and service status - **`/info`** - Returns comprehensive service information and API documentation
```json { "service": "bgutil-ytdlp-pot-provider", "version": "0.1.0", "description": "POT token generation service for yt-dlp", "endpoints": [ {"path": "/get_pot", "method": "POST", "description": "Generate POT token"}, {"path": "/health", "method": "GET", "description": "Detailed health check"} ] } ```
## Quality Assurance
-
**216 tests passing** (100% pass rate, including 6 new tests for deprecated field validation) -
**Zero compiler warnings** with `cargo clippy -- -D warnings` -
**Proper code formatting** with `cargo fmt` -
**Full documentation coverage** for new APIs -
**TypeScript behavior compatibility** verified through comprehensive testing
## Implementation Details
The middleware uses a clean architecture that: 1. Only applies to `/get_pot` POST requests (performance optimization) 2. Parses raw JSON before struct deserialization to catch deprecated fields 3. Properly reconstructs the request for downstream processing 4. Provides detailed error context for debugging
All existing functionality remains unchanged, ensuring zero breaking changes while adding the new validation layer.
Fixes #27.

feat: Implement Phase 5 - JSON validation and API improvements
- Add deprecated field validation middleware for data_sync_id and visitor_data - Enhance ErrorResponse with context, details, timestamps, and version - Add /health endpoint for detailed health information - Add /info endpoint for service information and available endpoints - Update router configuration with middleware and new endpoints - Add comprehensive test coverage for all new features - All tests pass and code quality checks satisfied
Co-authored-by: jim60105 <16995691+jim60105@users.noreply.github.com>
